newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila C. Bank offers two-week rrp at 25 pct.
newsitem.headline: Manila C. Bank offers two-week rrp at 25 pct.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank said on Monday it had started offering two-week reverse repos (rrp) at 25 percent.
It also continued to offer the four-day rrp at 25 percent.
The bank maintained its one-month reverse repo rate at 12.375 percent, the two-month rate at 12.5 percent, and the three and six-month rates at 12.625 percent.
The Central Bank likewise kept its overnight borrowing rate unchanged at 32 percent and its overnight lending rate at 34 percent.
The special series T-bill rates were also steady at 12.5 percent for the six-month bills and 12.1 percent for the three-month bills.
Traders said the Central Bank is keeping its high rates to help stabilise the peso.
